net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data

Interface DragAndDropTableModel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    TableModel

    public interface DragAndDropTableModel
extends TableModel
    Defines the interface for providing drag and drop on table model cells. For row level drag and drop see RowModel. A table model that is to take part in drag and drop operations at the cell level must implement this interface in addition to TableModel.
    Author:
    Pat Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DragSource getDragSourceAt(int rowIndex, int columnIndex)
      Returns the DragSource for the cell at columnIndex and rowIndex.
      DropTarget getDropTargetAt(int rowIndex, int columnIndex)
      Returns the DropTarget for the cell at columnIndex and rowIndex.

      • Methods inherited from interface net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data.TableModel

        addTableModelListener, canColumnSort, fireTableChanged, getColumnClass, getColumnCount, getColumnName, getColumnOrdering, getRowCount, getRowId, getValueAt, isCellEditable, isColumnFirstOrdered, isRowValid, removeTableModelListener, setOrderedColumn, setOrderedColumn, setValueAt

    • Method Detail

      • getDragSourceAt

        DragSource getDragSourceAt(int rowIndex,
                           int columnIndex)
        Returns the DragSource for the cell at columnIndex and rowIndex.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index, in the interval [0,getRowCount()], may be zero even if getRowCount() is zero.
        columnIndex - The column index, in the interval [0,getColumnCount()), may be zero even if getColumnCount() is zero.
        Returns:
        DragSource or null.

      • getDropTargetAt

        DropTarget getDropTargetAt(int rowIndex,
                           int columnIndex)
        Returns the DropTarget for the cell at columnIndex and rowIndex.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index, in the interval [0,getRowCount()], may be zero even if getRowCount() is zero.
        columnIndex - The column index, in the interval [0,getColumnCount()), may be zero even if getColumnCount() is zero.
        Returns:
        DropTarget or null.
